intro: Brossaea elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf brossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Brossaea elliptica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a specimen plant.
